headline: Mini Cheesecakes
description: This mini cheesecake recipe makes the perfect bite-sized dessert for parties, holidays, or any special occasion. Easy to make and even easier to eat!

video.description: These cheesecakes are both impressive and super easy.
video.name: Mini Cheesecakes I

name: Mini Cheesecakes

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line two 24-cup miniature muffin tins with paper liners.
Crush vanilla wafers. Place 1/2 teaspoon of crushed vanilla wafers into each paper cup.
Beat cream cheese, sugar, eggs, and vanilla in a mixing bowl until light and fluffy. Fill each miniature muffin liner with this mixture, almost to the top.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes until the cheesecake is set. Cool. Top with a teaspoonful of cherry pie filling.

review.reviewBody: These Mini Cheese Cakes are so.... easy to make! On of my families favorites.
Instead of mini cheesecakes, I poured this into a graham cracker pie crust. I also used a tablespoon of lemon juice and that made it tart and so good. This is my go to recipe for a delicious treat.

These are excellent as is, made countless times. My daughters favorite. This time for her birthday I made them with Almond extract instead of vanilla. Pickled cherries in Amaretto for topping and a chocolate wafer with butter and sugar crumble for base. Before serving I lightly drizzled a chocolate Ganache over them.

This recipe was outstanding. They were done to perfection. My family and guests love these and ask me to bring them anytime they need a dessert. I did not crush the wafers but instead I placed a whole regular size wafer at the bottom of each Reynolds mini foil baking cup.
These are great!!!!
I used Graham cracker crust instead of vanilla wafers but they were delicious .
Very simple to make. Guest love them. Can be made on very short notice.
Love the taste but I had so much leftover wafer crumbs and cheesecake batter.

Love these mini cheesecakes! I have made them numerous times and they are always a hit! Does anyone know if I can bake these as a full cheesecake instead of the minis? Do any recipe alterations need to be made?
Very easy and my favorite recipe!

I had a lot of technical challenges here for some reason. The crust/base didn't work well, it seemed like too thin of a layer and didn't stick to the cheesecake part. I also wish the cheesecake batter had been a bit more runny and able to be poured into the cups. Trying to spoon the rather thick batter evenly was challenging.

These were sooooo delicious!! (good thing looks have nothing to do with taste lol) I made the for my husband to take to work for his sweet tooth... Now he can't get enough... They are not just for special occasions!

This recipe is awesome for someone without a lot of experience and they’re a crowd pleaser! Everyone raves about them every Christmas. I made them for a shower as well and they were wiped out! Super easy and little mess. I find having a Kitchen Aid or stand mixer is perfect for the filling. Be sure to cream your cheese and sugar well before adding the egg and vanilla. Use a food processor or blender to grind your cookies. Enjoy!
It is great. We used a blender for a better silky turnout.
Awesomely delicious!!!
I'm diabetic,so I bake and give it away! The ones whom I have given them to loved the recipe!
These were amazing! Never made cheesecake before and they turned out fantastic! Very simple yet upscale restraunt quality! So impressed.
My guests raved over it! I’ve had better, but love the idea of having mini cheesecakes. I used graham cracker crust as suggested by other users and it makes a world of a difference

I followed the recipe except that i used organic sugar and blueberry topping instead and made them in regular sized cupcake pans. I did bake for 20 min. It turned out very delicious! Very very simple, easy, and quick! Impressed! Keeping this recipe for the cheesecake cravs!
Hated this. Made it exactly like the recipe but after the bake my cheesecake tops sunk way down. What’s up with that. Tasted way off too.
Good recipe, but definitely doesn’t make 48 servings. Added a few extra ingredients as well

Great basic recipe! I used it to make my own Apple Pie Crumble Cheesecakes instead of using the recommended cherry pie filling. I made my own thick, cinnamon-y apple pie filling with very finely chopped apples, put that on top of the raw cheesecake batter, and then topped it with a cinnamon streusel topping. Got rave reviews at both parties these went to. Also have used this recipe to make Oreo cheesecakes, substituting the thin Oreo cookies as the base instead of the Nilla Wafers, and then topping with a mini Oreo cookie before baking. So many flavor options with this recipe. A keeper. The only thing is that they took *significantly* longer to bake for a regular-size cupcake liner. Not sure if it's my oven.

These were very easy to make and came out well. I did adjust the crust using my preferred recipe which includes spices and brown sugar and butter, but the cake part I made according to the recipe. I'll definitely make again for another get-together

Fabulous! Because graham cracker crumbs are more available where I live (and less work) I mix them with melted butter as the base. I press them into the mini cupcake papers with a shot glass so they don’t crumble.

I fourthed the recipe since I was only making 12 mini cheesecakes. They are in the oven now and the problems I have run into so far is there isn’t enough cheesecake batter and the graham crackers don’t stick together. The cheesecake batter filled all 12 cheesecakes but you could still see the graham crackers since there was very little batter. I don’t know if it is like this since I fourthed it or if the recipe just runs short. Besides these two issues, the cheesecakes looked good.
Somehow way too eggy, followed the simple directions and it failed miserably amen.
People raved about this dessert. They came out perfect, light and creamy!

These tasted very good. But I don’t know where I went wrong. I used the only mini muffin tray my store had and ended up with WAY more ingredients than I needed. I used barely any of the package of smashed wafers. But there wasn’t quite enough cheesecake batter left for another batch. Idk. Maybe a specific size pan should be listed? These were also not really worth all the effort. They look cute and I could see bringing them to s party or something. But I just made them to eat at home. My family finished them off in an hour. Probably better to just make a real- cheesecake next time.
Very easy recipe and so delicious!
This is a wonderful recipe.

I made these last night and my husband and I loved them! This is a simple recipe but very delicious. I will be making these for my church coffee fellowship ministry this Sunday. Thank you for this recipe.

Super easy, super delicious! Instead of crushing the vanilla wafers, I place one wafer in the bottom 
of each muffin tin space. No need to crush!
It tastes GREAT!

I thought this was a very easy recipe. It's basically the recipe for my Mom's cheesecake that I have been making for years, except this recipe calls for way too much sugar. Especially if you are topping with more sugary things. I used only 1/2 C sugar.
After cream cheese was sitting out to room temp, then it blended quite nicely with all the ingredients in my Bosch stand mixer.
15 minutes was right on for the bake time, and I did mini's.
These came out great! I used crush oreos as a crust, didn’t put melted butter and it still came out good. I halved the recipe and added 2 teaspoons of lemon juice but i think it needs more.

Easy-peasy! Couple of changes I implemented...added 1/4 c unsalted butter to wafers before adding crumbs to paper liners, then baked for 10-15 minutes. Baked cheesecakes for 25 minutes. Hubby enjoyed them!

I made 12 cupcake sized cheesecakes.
I only had 1 1/2 cream cheese (12 ozs) so I added 1/4 cup of plain Greek yogurt. I also added a splash of lemon juice. Baked @ 350 for 18 minutes

I made exactly 48 mini cheesecakes. I used cherry pie filling only placing 1 cherry on 12 of them. I used strawberry pie filling placing only 1 strawberry on 12 of them. I placed a salted caramel morsel and a dark chocolate morsel in the middle of 12 cheesecakes then baked as directed. Once cooled slightly I drizzled hot fudge topping and caramel topping and then sprinkled pecan chips on top. The last 12 I kept plain. I will definitely make again maybe trying out other flavors....

These are absolutely delicious. This recipe is slightly different than the one I’m used to, but same ingredients. Usually I prefer to just use a whole cookie instead of crushing them. I use the muffin liners that fit the cookie perfectly. They can be hard to find though! So for this version, I crushed the cookies very well and used a full size liner. I had to bake them a few minutes more than 15 though. These are always a favorite in my family and my kids want them every Christmas!
make these little guys all the time! they are always a huge hit. i top them with a chocolate chip and i also use chocolate cookie crumbs.

I’ve been making this recipe for years but I make them in a regular muffin pan. One regular size vanilla wafer is the perfect size to form the crust inside your paper liners. I also only use 1/2 cup of sugar which is plenty sweet and bake at 350 for about 20 minutes. Very good! They are always the first to go!

I've made these several times in the past & they are delicious! Only difference is I use reg. cupcake papers & then use one vanilla cookie on the bottom.. add your cream cheese mixture & when cool add your topping...so easy & so delicious!
This was okay, but I didn't really enjoy the cream cheese flavor. I couldn't taste the vanilla wafers, the cream cheese overpowered it. Besides that, the recipe was good.
made these last night followed recipe as directed, they were Amazing !!! Thank you for sharing :)
I make this every weekend and we snack on them during the week. I put oreos at the bottom to save time. I also top with white and dark chocolate chips! Very rich, but very good!

Great recipe. Made the first time exactly as written except using graham cracker crust (roughly 12-16 full sz grahams run through food processor to make into crumbs; 7-8 tbsp butter melted combine and instead of pressing into muffin papers made into small balls and rolled and flattened then set into muffin wrapper...MUCH easier to get out of wrapper than the few I pressed) instead of nilla wafers just due to personal preference. 
2nd time around I tweaked a little :-) added a little lemon juice a little less sugar and 1/2 additional tsp vanilla and each time baked for approximately 17 minutes (do NOT wait until batter is cracking!) and then just turned off the oven and left for about 45 minutes to an hour. Cheesecakes turned out AMAZING! 
Couple tips-
-absolutely NEED cream cheese room temp!!!
-before adding anything else beat till as smooth as possible!
-add sugar beat again and again nice and smooth batter needed I can't emphasize that enough from years of making cheesecakes with mom and grandma
-add in eggs and beat until just mixed and then pour/scoop into cups :-)
SO many other possibilities/additions to make chocolate cheesecake or really whatever flavor you want! Will definitely keep making!!!! Thanks!

These were such a big hit at my family bbq. So much that I am to bring this every time we get together! However I Filled the cupcake liners to the top instead of 3/4 of the way. Used graham crackers crust instead. But followed the cheesecake recipe
Very easy to make and tasted good, but I felt like the texture was lacking something.
Good dish. We used graham cracker crumbs mixed with butter in place of the vanilla wafers
super easy to make. i used blueberry pie filling and some lemon zest. they didn't last for an hour at the work function.
i made this with graham cracker crust and it was amazing
I omitted the cherry topped it with fresh raspberries and light dusting of confection sugar
If I can do it any one can do it !! I'm not a fan of cheesecake but these are just delish !! Making them for party desserts!

I first came across this recipe when I was in the Air Force in the 1980s (thank you Sgt Falkenberry!). I’ve been using it as one of my go to take along recipes since. It’s very flexible and can be modified with more or less sugar, different cookie crusts (pick a hard cookie) and any (or no) topping you feel like. Do make sure you use the metal baking cups, because they’ll be easier when it comes time to eat.
USEd graham crackers for crust, perfect!
I followed the recipe exactly and the result was a hit! I didn’t go for 5 stars because I had way too many crumbs left after using all the filling. Wasted about a half of a box of mills wafers
Real easy, very tasty!!
I followed the directions but used graham cracker crumbs instead. I’m giving this 3 stars because they came out looking great but had a terrible after taste. I’m not sure what happened.
I used graham cracker crumbs for crust. Easy and delicious! Everyone enjoyed them.

Made these for my daughter and fiancé - didn't use any fruit as they don't care for it. I left the vanilla wafers full size, as well. My first attempt at cheesecake was a success! I look forward to trying variations of this recipe!

I think you need to change the written recipe. First of all it says to use a half a teaspoon of the vanilla wafers in the wrappers. When I watched the video, it said to use a whole teaspoon. I believe it is a whole teaspoon.. Also I would add to this recipe (that I read) that it makes about 48 cheesecakes.. I had no idea how many rappers to get ready and how many it would make. When I watched the video, it told me 48. Also I would like to add if you put the vanilla wafers in each cup crushed, they fall apart when you open them to eat them and crumbs get everywhere. I suggest you put the vanilla wafer in there whole or I added half a box of vanilla wafers and a package of graham crackers and crush them up and added about a cup of melted butter. They turned out really good and didn't fall apart when you opened them to eat them.??

I made a crust with 2 cups of crushed vanilla wafers, 1 stick of melted butter and 1/2 cup of sugar. Put 1/2 tsp of this in the bottom of the mini muffin liner. I used caramel ice cream topping with chopped pecans for the topping.
The cheesecake was a hit! I used almond extract instead of the vanilla and they were delicious. Very easy recipe. Will definitely make again.
Turned out nicely but next time will make with graham cracker crust, taste was a little bland
Awesome but I’m not a huge fan of a lot of vanilla flavoring
This recipe is awesome!! I made it exactly as it is. I was the star of a church event! These look like I spent a million hours in the kitchen. Seriously easy!! Thank you for sharing this recipe!
I will absolutely make this recipe again. Very simple. Only thing I'd do differently is adjust cook time or temp down. Thank you! And Enjoy!
Everybody loved these.

Wow! This is SO easy. And SO delicious! I substituted lime juice (what I had) in place of vanilla like another reviewer suggested. I have a batch baking now with no crust and made with stevia - for the diabetics and low carb folks in the family. Can’t wait to try other flavors. Thanks to all the reviewers who suggested enchancements. This is a keeper. And will look gorgeous on the holiday dessert table.
Can these be made in advance and frozen??
The base is a bit crumbly. Let them cool well before topping them.
amazing and so so so easy to make! everyone loved them!
Turned out perfect!

Made no changes, found it to taste a little off. I can't figure out what it is though. They didn't taste bad, just off. I make normal cheesecakes weekly for a restaurant so I'm no novice to cheesecake techniques. My husband said they weren't as rich as a normal one, but I'm going to make again with a bit more finesse! They are very easy to make and definitely worth a chance. If nothing else, its a great, easy base to start with.
Great topped with cherries, strwberries or pineapple
Very quick and good basic recipe for cheesecake. I look forward to trying variations.
Very delicious! The family and friends devoured it!
half for about 20. use 1 cup graham cracker crumbs mixed with half a stick of butter and 4 tablespoons sugar. very good.

I've made this recipe several times now. My family really loves them! They aren't too sweet, which is what my family enjoys. Most of my family like them plain without the cherry topping. When we make the very mini cheesecakes, we don't need anywhere near the recommended amount of vanilla wafers. (I made a half batch of 24 minature "minis" and did not use anywhere near 6 oz for the 1/2 batch. I only use the recommended 1/2 teaspoon per miniature muffin cup. Next time I'll try 2 or 3 ounces of Vanilla wafers crushed for a half batch.) We really enjoy the "mini" mini cheesecakes. One bite desserts! Of course, everyone usually picks up one, walks away, then comes back for another. Very easy to make and everyone enjoys them!
It was a quick and easy dessert that looks great but mine were more eggy than cheesecake-y. I'll use more cream cheese next time .
Super easy and yummy
Thanks to Janice. This is much better than the store. Definitely will make it often.
I replaced the vanilla wafers with graham crackers and a little butter! Turned out pretty well!

This was such a simple cheesecake to make. I've only made a no-make cheesecake before because I found baking a cheesecake intimidating. This was very easy and very tasty. 

I only made 3 changes to the original recipe. 1) I used a standard muffin/cupcake pan and cupcake liners. 2) I halved the recipe so that I wouldn't be alone with all that goodness. I was making this for only 2 people. Really, one because I'm on a diet. This yielded about 9 cupcakes. 3) I baked them for 15 minutes but they looked too loose, so I baked them for an additional 8 minutes. 

I let them cool and placed them in the fridge for about 2 hours. And then I topped them with the cherry pie filling/topping.

Well, we're eating them, but not overly thrilled about them. I thought they needed a bit more sugar, or maybe even a splash of lemon. I chose to use a whole cookie on the bottom rather than crumble the cookie. I am looking for one recipe I remember a co-worker using that had sour cream in the recipe. I'll keep looking. Sorry, but won't use this recipe again.

These were so easy to make and I made half of them gluten free by using gluten free soft baked gingerbread and snickerdoodle cookies for the crust. The gluten free were better than the traditional recipe using vanilla wafers.
I made these for my wife and kids, they loved them. I added red food coloring to make the cheesecake pink. :-)
These are easy! Just made these to try before Thanksgiving. I'll be doubling the recipe for sure. You can also use different Topping's like fruits and syrups and jams!

I love these. There were a few false starts because I knew absolutely nothing about making cheesecake. I missed the miniature muffin tin part and had a hard time figuring out why my batch never made as many as the recipe said it should. I also had to cook mine a little longer since they were bigger which led to me over baking a few times which makes the mixture a little eggy. They were still good, but you didn't get that rich creamy cheesecake texture or taste. You want there to still be a little jiggle in the middle. Once I got it down though, these were great. I bring them (as well as Paula Deen's sausage balls) to work potlucks and there are never any left over.
Great recipe! I only added lemon juice for additional favor.

The crust I made with graham crackers but will maybe add less butter next time and use brown sugar instead, after being refrigerated overnight I can truly enjoy the cheesecake! So delicious this recipe is perfect not too sweet and allows the fruit on top to give it the sweetness to perfection not an overload
very easy to make for quick and delicious little bites !!!
Everyone loved them!!!
My granddaughter gave this opinion when she ate it. Grandma, It was good, but you need to work on the crust. It's crumbly.

I made this the way the recipe was written, and it was fabulous! Doesn't even need any toppings. Just a FYI, you won't use the whole bag of wafers. I crushed about half of the box and had some of the crushed mixture leftover.
I love these i saw my mom made theses and they were so good i asked for a recipe

I followed some of the suggestions offered by other reviewers: let the cream cheese warm to room temperature before using (or heat it for 30 seconds-1 minute in the microwave), didn't completely crush the vanilla wafers (which helped them stick together better), and taking them out of the oven before they cracked (when possible). Rich, but not too sweet, these really are delicious! I'm excited to try them again but with other mix-ins.
It didn't set well. The crust at the bottom didn't stay attached good, but maybe I didn't add enough. They tasted good but not great.

I have made these several times, and they have been perfect each time! To appeal to different tastes, I made an Oreo crust . Instead of grinding them, I put them whole into the bottom of the tins, this helped to prevent crumbling. I then put them in the oven and they came out amazing! I served most of these with either whip cream and strawberries, Oreos and whip cream, and Reese's peanut butter cups and whip cream. If I had to criticize one thing about them it would be the density of them, but they were still delicious!
